column1: Weighted MRI size (128, 256, 1) in T2 showing the head of a man of 37 years old, of sagittal section n°110 starting from the right hemisphere of the skull. The image notably reveals the presence of: the white matter of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 5422.4121 mm³, the cortex of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 4271.4844 mm³, the left lateral ventricle of volume 284.7656 mm³, the white matter of left hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 570.8496 mm³, the left cerebellar cortex of volume 1613.6719 mm³, the left thalamus of volume 436.3770 mm³, the left caudate nucleus of volume 313.7695 mm³, the left putamen of volume 69.8730 mm³, the left globus pallidus of volume 94.9219 mm³, the brainstem of volume 164.7949 mm³, the left hippocampus of volume 55.3711 mm³, the left amygdala of volume 60.6445 mm³ and the left ventral diencephalon of volume 130.5176 mm³.
